results.name: Expansion of g.f.: (1+x)/(1+2*x+4x^2).
comment: a(n+1) is the Hankel transform of C(2n,n)-C(2n+2,n+1). - _Paul Barry_, Mar 14 2008
a(n+1) is the Hankel transform of C(2n,n)-2*C(n)=((n-1)/(n+1))*C(2n,n), where C(n)=A000108(n). - _Paul Barry_, Mar 14 2008
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-2,-4).
formula: a(n) = (1/2)*{[ -1+I*sqrt(3)]^n+[ -1-I*sqrt(3)]^n}, with n>=0. - _Paolo P. Lava_, Nov 19 2008
G.f.: G(0)/2, where G(k)= 1 + 1/(1 - x*(3*k+1)/(x*(3*k+4) - 1/G(k+1))); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, May 26 2013
a(n) = b(n)+b(n-1) where b(n) = 2^n*A049347(n). - _R. J. Mathar_, May 21 2019
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(1 + x) / (1 + 2 x + 4 x^2), {x, 0, 40}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 16 2014 *)
program: (MAGMA) I:=[1, -1]; [n le 2 select I[n] else -2*Self(n-1)-4*Self(n-2): n in [1..40]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 16 2014
